ext_descriptions.ext_description: An extend_or_chord_2_extend_or_truncate_or_round lists the possible corner_style values.
specifies that the value is truncate;
specifies that the value is chord to extend;
specifies that the value is round;
specifies that the value is extend;
A extend_or_truncate lists the possible end_extension values.
specifies that the value is truncate;
specifies that the value is extend;
A square_or_round lists the possible end_style values.
specifies that the value is square;
specifies that the value is round;

A Curve_style_parameters is the definition of a set of properties that are of a geometric nature. Curve_style_parameters provides parametric data used by a processor to create physical material along a path, where the path is described outside of the style. The Curve_style_parameters algorithm is rule based and is formally described in the domain rules. The width_uncertainty represents the uncertainty in the originating CAD system, not a material processing tolerance.
specifies the for the identifier for the Curve_style_parameters.

specifies either the "round" or "square" style ends for the Curve_style_parameters. Figures 1 and 2 illustrate the construction options associated with square corners. These illustrations shall be interpreted as describing construction of the outer boundary near the end only. At some distance away from the end, the basic width attribute governs the shape. Figure 4 illustrates the construction of the end treatment of the curve. The end treatment is applied individually to each end. Figure 5 illustrates the completed result for a that has been styled using this Curve_style_parameters. Even though the does not show material inside, that is required if the is applied to material.
Curve end treatment
Completed curve

ext_description.p: specifies how the physical material will terminate on the that is the start or end of the centreline curve. The end_extension is applied by a continuation (termination) of the that is being styled along the tangent to the at the terminus of the . If the end_extension is "extend", there will be material added after the . If the end_extension is "truncate", there will be no material added after the .
ext_description.note: This Application Object does not describe tolerances associated with fabrication processes. Reference as an example of tolerance information related to fabrication processes.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Curve_style_parameters.

specifies either the "extend" or "chord 2 extend" or "round" or "truncate" style for the Curve_style_parameters. Figures 1 and 2 illustrate the construction options associated with "extend", "chord 2 extend" and "truncate" corners. These illustrations shall be interpreted as describing construction of the outer boundary near the intersection only. At some distance away from the intersection, the basic width attribute governs the shape. Figure 3 illustrates the construction associated with round corners. Figure 4 illustrates the construction of the end treatment of the curve. The end treatment is applied individually to each end. Figure 5 illustrates the completed result for a that has been styled using this Curve_style_parameters. Even though the does not show material inside, that is required if the is applied to material.
Square corners with extend
Square corners with truncate
Round corners
the words by which the Curve_style_parameters is known.
The name shall be unique within a population of Curve_style_parameters.

ext_description.p: A Reference_packaged_part_interconnect_implementation is a type of . A Reference_packaged_part_interconnect_implementation is intended only to be used in a library context to provide support to describe information not available in the template itself.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The Reference_packaged_part_interconnect_implementation shall only be associated with a product in the category of 'template model'.

A Default_trace_template is a type of . The Default_trace_template is associated with a particular , to allow verification that the design of the trace template meets the relevant minimum and maximum guidelines of that .
specifies the role of the for the Default_trace_template.

ext_description.p: A Part_text_template is a type of that is the information required to support the creation of text messages in the stratum material on the or in a marking application.
ext_description.note: The explicit shape of the Part_text_template is provided in the , and Application objects.
The explicit shape of the bounding box for the Part_text_template is provided in the and the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the that is the distance across a single line that draws the glyph for the Part_text_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the that is the deviation from vertical for the Part_text_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the role of the for the extent of the Part_text_template in the negative Y direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the role of the for the extent of the Part_text_template in the negative X direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the role of the for the extent of the Part_text_template in the positive Y direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the role of the for the extent of the Part_text_template in the positive X direction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies either the or the for the Part_text_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The glyph shape shall not extend beyond the shape established by the shape of the template.
At least one of the attributes shall be provided.

ext_description.p: A Snowball_template is a type of that describes the shape of material to be added to a trace termination that is parameterized by the radius of the material addition geometry. The Snowball_template edge is required to be overlapping the that is associated by virtue of the that references the occurrence of the Snowball_template. The parameters associated with a Snowball_template allow for one or more shapes to be instantiated with the same . The center of the circle or circles shall be on the centreline curve of the associated referenced indirectly by the .
ext_description.note: The occurrence of a Snowball_template will be a that is referenced by a by the attribute.
The is associated because the directly referenced by references a .

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the an integer quantity of snowballs.
specifies a role of the for the Snowball_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of the for the Snowball_template.
specifies a role of the for the Snowball_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of the for the Snowball_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of the for the Snowball_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of the for the Snowball_template.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: If a snowball_quantity_per_trace is greater than zero, the following shall be provided: snowball_end_distance, snowball_initial_spacing, snowball_end_spacing, snowball_initial_radius, snowball_end_radius.
There shall be no refering this Snowball_template as and no refering this Snowball_template as and no refering this Snowball_template as .

ext_description.p: A Special_symbol_part_template is a type of that defines a special symbol.
ext_description.example: A corporate logo would be a Special_symbol_part_template.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the . There may be one or more . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Teardrop_by_angle_template is a type of that describes the shape of material to be added to a trace termination that is parameterized by the angle of the material addition geometry. The Teardrop_by_angle_template edge is required to be tangential to the that is associated by virtue of the that references the occurrence of the Teardrop_by_angle_template. The vertex of the angle shall be on the centreline of the associated by the . The angle shall be less than 90 degrees.
ext_description.note: The occurrence of a Teardrop_by_angle_template will be a that is referenced by a by the attribute.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Teardrop_by_angle_template.
There shall be no refering this Teardrop_by_angle_template as and no refering this Teardrop_by_angle_template as and no refering this Teardrop_by_angle_template as .

A Teardrop_by_length_template is a type of that describes the shape of material to be added to a design feature. The teardrop_taper_start_distance and teardrop_taper_end_distance shall be measured from the location of the of the referenced by the that references a that is an occurrence of Teardrop_by_length_template. The centreline of the that is an occurrence of the Teardrop_by_length_template shall be congruent with the centreline of the it is associated with.
specifies one role of the for the Teardrop_by_length_template.
specifies one role of the for the Teardrop_by_length_template.
There shall be no refering this Teardrop_by_length_template as and no refering this Teardrop_by_length_template as and no refering this Teardrop_by_length_template as .

ext_description.p: A Trace_template is a type of whose purpose is to define the width of a and the style of the ends and corners of that . A Trace_template may be a .

example.p: Figure 6 illustrates the cross-section view related to a Trace_template. The parameters included in the illustration are included in the for the associated and will be assigned specific values through and associated application objects.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of the for the Trace_template.
ext_description.note: The Trace_template uses the parametric information in , not the graphical presentation information.
